relationships.description: Ailes attempted to give advice to Trump but gave up
Email correspondence about Trump and Ailes

analysis.purpose: To share an anecdote about Roger Ailes' experience with Donald Trump and respond to Jeffrey Epstein's question
analysis.significance: Provides insight into the relationship dynamics between prominent political figures during the 2016 election

notable_quotes: Ailes said he gave up trying to give advice, that Trump was the boy in pre-school who you just knew was going to throw a truck at another kid's head.
did trump also ignore ailes? wild

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion present in this casual political anecdote

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity discussed - just political commentary and personal observations

public_knowledge.context: This appears to be private communication about political figures during the 2016 presidential election, offering behind-the-scenes perspective on Trump's behavior and relationships

analysis.summary: Michael Wolff shares an anecdote from Roger Ailes about Donald Trump being difficult to advise, comparing Trump to a disruptive preschool child, in response to Jeffrey Epstein's question about whether Trump ignored Ailes.
